lead_paragraph: A dark bay colt from the same sire as the 2006 Kentucky Derby winner, Barbaro, fetched the high price of $2.9 million during the first day of Keeneland’s yearling sale. Sheik Mohammed bin Rashid al-Maktoum, the ruler of Dubai, paid the winning price for the yearling by Dynaformer out of Preach. Barbaro was undefeated when he won the Derby before breaking his leg early in the Preakness. He was euthanized Jan. 29 after a long fight to survive.
